content.title: Scheme for Providing Employment Opportunities by Establishing Piggery, Sheep and Goat Units (General)
content.details: The scheme is implemented by the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying, Government of Haryana. This is a credit-linked scheme with a primary objective of providing self-employment opportunities. Unemployed persons will be assisted by establishing Sheep or Goat Units (15 female + 1 male) and Piggery Units (10 female + 1 male).
benefits: 25% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing a 10+1 Piggery unit, with a maximum of ₹25,000/- as financial assistance.
25% subsidy on the cost of livestock for establishing a 15+1 Sheep/Goat unit, with a maximum of ₹24,500/- as financial assistance.
Financial assistance for livestock insurance if operational.
eligibility: Applicant should be 18 to 55 years of age and a resident of Haryana.
No mandatory educational qualifications or training requirements.
Applicant should have a space/shed for keeping animals.
Applicants who have previously availed benefits under any Departmental Scheme for livestock unit establishment are not eligible.
exclusions: Any group/firm/organization will not be permitted to apply under the Scheme.
content.application_process: Online - via Antyodaya-SARAL Portal and Common Service Centres.
documents_required: Copy of Bank Passbook or Cancelled Cheque
Proof of availability of shed/space for keeping animals

faqs.question: What is the primary objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary objective is to provide self-employment opportunities to unemployed persons by assisting them in establishing Sheep, Goat, or Piggery units.

faqs.question: What kind of units can be established under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Beneficiaries can establish Sheep/Goat units (15 female + 1 male) or Piggery units (10 female + 1 male).

faqs.question: What are the medium-term objectives of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To provide self-employment, socio-economic security to weaker sections, and increase wool, meat, and pork production in the state.

faqs.question: How does the department assist beneficiaries in establishing these units?
faqs.answer: The department assists by sponsoring loan applications to banks, purchasing animals, tagging, issuing health certificates, providing veterinary health and other facilities, and imparting 11 days of Dairy husbandry training.
